# BMAD Skills for Claude Code

> AI-driven development framework with specialized agent skills.
> Structured phases: Analysis → Planning → Solutioning → Implementation.

## Quick Start

Install:
```bash
curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/bmadmethod/claude-code-bmad-skills/main/install-v6.sh | bash
```

Initialize in project:
```bash
cd your-project
# In Claude Code session:
/workflow-init
```

## Essential Commands

```bash
# Phase 1 - Analysis
/product-brief [create|validate|edit]   # Product brief (trimodal)
/brainstorm                             # 100+ ideas, domain pivots
/research                               # Market/competitive research

# Phase 2 - Planning
/prd [create|validate|edit]             # PRD (trimodal)
/tech-spec                              # Technical specification
/create-ux-design                       # UX design

# Phase 3 - Solutioning
/architecture [create|validate|edit]    # System architecture (trimodal)
/solutioning-gate-check                 # Validate architecture

# Phase 4 - Implementation
/sprint-planning                        # Plan sprints
/create-story                           # Create user story
/dev-story STORY-ID                     # Implement story
/code-review STORY-PATH                 # Adversarial code review
/retrospective [EPIC]                   # Epic retrospective
/course-correct                         # Mid-sprint changes

# Quality & Testing
/test-framework                         # Set up testing
/test-atdd                              # Acceptance TDD
/test-design                            # Test strategy
/test-review                            # Test quality audit

# Documentation
/document-project                       # Project documentation
/generate-context                       # LLM context file
/api-doc                                # API documentation

# Diagrams (Excalidraw)
/create-diagram                         # Architecture, ERD, UML
/create-flowchart                       # Process flows
/create-wireframe                       # UI wireframes
/create-dataflow                        # Data flow diagrams

# Status
/workflow-status                        # Check progress
/ready-work                             # Show unblocked work
```

## Project Levels

| Level | Scope | Stories | Approach |
|-------|-------|---------|----------|
| 0 | Single atomic change | 1 | `/quick-spec` + `/quick-dev` |
| 1 | Small feature | 1-10 | `/quick-spec` + `/quick-dev` |
| 2 | Medium feature set | 5-15 | Full BMAD workflow |
| 3 | Complex integration | 12-40 | Full BMAD workflow |
| 4 | Enterprise expansion | 40+ | Full BMAD workflow |

## Trimodal Workflows

Major commands support three modes:
- **Create** (`-c`): Build new document via interview
- **Validate** (`-v`): Review existing document against standards
- **Edit** (`-e`): Improve based on validation or feedback

```bash
/prd                  # Shows mode menu
/prd create           # Direct to create mode
/prd -v               # Direct to validate mode
/architecture edit    # Direct to edit mode
```

## File Structure

```
project/
├── bmad/
│   ├── config.yaml              # Project configuration
│   ├── context/                 # Subprocess shared context
│   └── outputs/                 # Subprocess outputs
├── docs/
│   ├── bmm-workflow-status.yaml # Workflow progress
│   ├── sprint-status.yaml       # Sprint tracking
│   ├── stories/                 # User story documents
│   ├── product-brief-*.md       # Phase 1 outputs
│   ├── prd-*.md                 # Phase 2 outputs
│   └── architecture-*.md        # Phase 3 outputs
└── .claude/
    └── commands/bmad/           # Project-specific commands
```

## Subprocess Strategy

BMAD skills leverage parallel subprocesses (~150K tokens each):

1. Decompose task into independent subtasks
2. Launch parallel subprocesses via Task tool
3. Coordinate via `bmad/context/`
4. Synthesize results from `bmad/outputs/`

## Beads Integration

If beads (`bd`) is installed:
- SessionStart hook runs `bd prime` for context injection
- `/create-story` syncs to beads issue
- `/ready-work` combines beads + BMAD data
- SessionEnd hook runs `bd sync`
